channel.title: Help [Compiler]
channel.description:
All my compiler says is: [code] Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Here is the code for that compiler: [code] @echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -sourcepath src src\*.java src\sign\*.java -d bin pause [/code]
When I try my normal compiler I get this: [code] javac: file not found: src\server\event\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
With the code being: [code]@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Class/ Java/*.java Java/sign/*.java pause[/code]
It doesn't compile successfully at all. This IS a client compiler, if that makes any difference. Anything would help. ;)

item.title: Help [Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

All my compiler says is:

Press any key to continue . . .

Here is the code for that compiler:

@echo off
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -sourcepath src src\*.java 
src\sign\*.java -d bin
pause

When I try my normal compiler I get this:

javac: file not found: src\server\event\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .

With the code being:

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Class/ Java/*.java Java/sign/*.java pause

It doesn’t compile successfully at all.
This IS a client compiler, if that makes any difference. Anything would help.

Read full topic
